intro: Hieracium alpicola var. angustifolium, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, elongated leaves that are typically covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. This variety is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
